subject: Business
title: Flywheel Effect: Momentum Builds on Itself
description: A 60-second lesson on Flywheel Effect: Momentum Builds on Itself.

hook.text: Amazon's flywheel: lower prices attract more customers, which attract more sellers, which lower prices further.

buildup.text: Jim Collins described the flywheel: each push adds energy. After many pushes, momentum becomes self-sustaining.

discovery.text: There's no single defining push. It's the accumulation of consistent actions in the same direction.

twist.text: Most companies never build flywheel momentum because they keep changing direction every quarter.

climax.text: Amazon printed its flywheel on a napkin in 2001. They've been spinning it the same way for 25 years.

punchline.text: Consistency in one direction beats brilliance in many.

quiz.question: What is the flywheel effect?
options: Consistent actions compound until momentum becomes self-sustaining
A sudden breakthrough that transforms a business
Spinning off subsidiaries to create value
